bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign of a sensation of a salty taste on the surface of the tongue despite the fact that one has not ingested any beverage or food. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao 百病主治藥：舌咸：知母瀉腎 For salty taste of the tongue , zhi mu drains the kidneys”. LSZ: 舌苦是膽熱，甘是脾熱，酸是濕熱，澀是風熱，辛是燥 熱，咸是脾濕，淡是胃虛 , “A bitter taste of the tongue results from gallbladder heat; a sweet taste [of the tongue] results from spleen heat; a sour taste results from moisture heat; a roughness results from wind heat; an acrid taste results from dryness heat; a salty taste results from spleen moisture; a tasteless [tongue] results from stomach depletion”.
